curam.util.client.domain.marshal

Class SimpleXPathMarshal

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.common.plugin.AbstractPlugIn
      • curam.util.common.domain.AbstractDomainPlugIn
        • curam.util.client.domain.marshal.AbstractDomainMarshal
          • curam.util.client.domain.marshal.SimpleXPathMarshal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DomainMarshal, DomainPlugIn, PlugIn
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleXPathADCMarshal

    public class SimpleXPathMarshal
extends AbstractDomainMarshal

    A marshal for string values that represent XML documents. The marshal supports paths that represent a simple subset of the location paths defined by the W3C XPath 1.0 recommendation.

    Supported XPath Location Paths

    Only a very small subset of XPath 1.0 is supported. The supported paths and their operation are described in the SimpleXPathEngine class.

    Reusing this Marshal

    This marshal plug-in class can be used directly to handle domains where the values are read-only and where data entered on forms does not need to be assembled into an XML value to be returned to the application server. If the data is used in input controls on a form page, then you will need to extend this class to implement a suitable assemble(Map) method; (the SimpleXPathMarshal.assemble(Map) method of this class only returns an empty string).

    If overriding the other methods of this class, be aware that the type of the first argument to those methods (called context on most methods), is SimpleXPathMarshal.DOMContextHelper. This is the object returned from the SimpleXPathMarshal.preResolve(String) method and the same instance of this object will be passed to all methods for any given server interface property accessed during the display (rendering) phase of processing. If extra context information is required, you can override the SimpleXPathMarshal.createDOMContextHelper(Node) method to return a new sub-class of the DOMContextHelper class with your context information.

    Data Conversion

    To convert the selected DOM nodes to formatted or raw values before they are returned by the getter methods, the nodes are passed to the SimpleXPathMarshal.convertData(Path, Object, Object, boolean) method. This method can be overridden to implement different conversion mechanism than the default mechanism described in that method's documentation.

      • preResolve

        public java.lang.Object preResolve(java.lang.String data)
                            throws MarshalException
        Parses the data, which is expected to be a string representing an XML document, to a DOM Document object. The returned DOM document is cached automatically and is passed to the getter methods when resolving paths.
        Specified by:
        preResolve in interface DomainMarshal
        Overrides:
        preResolve in class AbstractDomainMarshal
        Parameters:
        data - The XML document string.
        Returns:
        The DOM document parsed from the XML string.
        Throws:
        MarshalException - If the parsing fails.

      • get

        public java.lang.String get(java.lang.Object context,
                            Path path)
                     throws MarshalException

        Gets the string value of a the first node (in document order)--or, in the case of some function calls, the first atomic value--selected by the simple XPath expression given by the path. The path is evaluated with respect to the given context object (a DOM node).

        The SimpleXPathMarshal.convertData(Path, Object, Object, boolean) method is called with the format parameter set to true to determine the string value to return from this method.

        To distinguish between an attribute or element that is present but has an empty string value and an attribute or element that is not present at all, use the SimpleXPathMarshal.getRaw(Object, Path) method and test if the result is an empty string or a null value.

        Parameters:
        context - The context node against which the path will be evaluated.
        path - The path that represents a simple XPath expression.
        Returns:
        The string value of the first selected node.
        Throws:
        MarshalException - If the path is not valid.

      • getList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getList(java.lang.Object context,
                                                Path path)
                                         throws MarshalException

        Gets the list containing the string values of the nodes (in document order)--or, in the case of some function calls, the list of atomic values--selected by the path with respect to the context node. The conversion of attribute and element nodes to string values is consistent with the behavior of the SimpleXPathMarshal.get(Object, Path) method.

        If the path represent an XPath function call, then the result is the single result of the function on the selected nodes, not the result of the function on each node. Most functions operate only on the first node when presented with a list of several nodes (see SimpleXPathEngine for details). For example, /values/value[3]/* selects all of the child elements of the third "value" element within the "values" root element. The resulting list will contain the three string objects, one each for the body text of each element. However, evaluating the path /values/value[3]/*/name() will return a list containing a single string that is the name of the first selected element ("addr"), not one string for the name of each selected element.

        Specified by:
        getList in interface DomainMarshal
        Overrides:
        getList in class AbstractDomainMarshal
        Parameters:
        context - The context node against which the path will be evaluated.
        path - The path that represents a simple XPath expression.
        Returns:
        The string values of the selected nodes, or an empty list if no nodes are selected.
        Throws:
        MarshalException - If the path is not valid.

      • getRaw

        public java.lang.Object getRaw(java.lang.Object context,
                               Path path)
                        throws MarshalException

        Gets the first raw value of the first node (in document order)--or, in the case of some function calls, the first atomic value--selected by the path with respect to the context node. The conversion of attribute and element nodes to string values is consistent with the behavior of the SimpleXPathMarshal.get(Object, Path) method, except that the SimpleXPathMarshal.convertData(Path, Object, Object, boolean) method is called with the format parameter set to false.

        If the path represents an XPath function call, then the result is the result of that function call on all selected nodes (see the SimpleXPathEngine class for details). If no nodes are selected, the result of the function call may be non-null.

        Specified by:
        getRaw in interface DomainMarshal
        Overrides:
        getRaw in class AbstractDomainMarshal
        Parameters:
        context - The context node against which the path will be evaluated.
        path - The path that represents a simple XPath expression.
        Returns:
        The selected value, or null if no node is selected by the path.
        Throws:
        MarshalException - If the path is not valid.

      • getRawList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> getRawList(java.lang.Object context,
                                                   Path path)
                                            throws MarshalException
        Gets the list of raw values of the nodes (in document order)--or, in the case of some function calls, the list of atomic values--selected by the path with respect to the context node. The behavior of this method is consistent with the list handling of the SimpleXPathMarshal.getList(Object, Path) method and the data conversion of the SimpleXPathMarshal.getRaw(Object, Path) method.
        Specified by:
        getRawList in interface DomainMarshal
        Overrides:
        getRawList in class AbstractDomainMarshal
        Parameters:
        context - The context node against which the path will be evaluated.
        path - The path that represents a simple XPath expression.
        Returns:
        The list of raw values, or an empty list if no nodes are selected.
        Throws:
        MarshalException - If the path is not valid.

      • count

        public int count(java.lang.Object context,
                 Path path)
          throws MarshalException
        Counts the number of nodes selected by the given path with respect to the given context node. If the path represents a function call, then the count represents the number of results from the function (usually one).
        Specified by:
        count in interface DomainMarshal
        Overrides:
        count in class AbstractDomainMarshal
        Parameters:

        path - The path that represents a simple XPath expression.
        Returns:
        The number of selected nodes.
        Throws:
        MarshalException - If the path is not valid.

      • selectSequence

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.Object> selectSequence(SimpleXPathMarshal.DOMContextHelper contextHelper,
                                                          Path path)
                                                   throws MarshalException
        Gets a list of the nodes that match the given path with respect to the given context node. See SimpleXPathEngine for more details of the selection process.
        Parameters:
        contextHelper - The holder/helper object for the context node against which the path will be evaluated.
        path - The path that represents a simple XPath expression.
        Returns:
        The list of selected nodes. This will be empty if no nodes were selected.
        Throws:
        MarshalException - If the path is not valid.

      • convertData

        protected java.lang.Object convertData(Path path,
                                       java.lang.Object context,
                                       java.lang.Object nodeOrValue,
                                       boolean format)
                                throws MarshalException

        Converts the string value of a node or atomic value to a raw or formatted value. The value may be an attribute node, an element node, another type of atomic value object, or null.

        Where the format parameter is true, the value returned will be a string and will be determined according to these rules:

        • The value of an attribute node is the string value of the attribute.
        • The value of an element node is the concatenation of the values of all of the child text nodes of that element.
        • If the value is a type other than a node (such as a string value returned from an XPath function call), the result of calling toString() on the value is returned.
        • If the node or value is null, an empty string is returned.

        This is consistent with use of the standard XPath string() function on the selected nodes or value, except, in the case of an element node, where only direct child text nodes of an element are concatenated, not all descendant text nodes as would be normal for XPath.

        Where the format parameter is false, the raw value returned will be calculated as above, except that:

        • If the value is a type other than a node, the value is returned.
        • If the node or value is null, null is returned.

        If the node is an attribute or atomic value resulting from a function call, then its value is returned without any conversion.

        Parameters:
        path - The Path used to select the node.
        context - The context object.
        nodeOrValue - The node or atomic value to convert.
        format - true to format the result to a string representation, false to return the raw value.
        Returns:
        The raw or formatted value.
        Throws:
        MarshalException - If the conversion fails.

      • createDOMContextHelper

        protected SimpleXPathMarshal.DOMContextHelper createDOMContextHelper(org.w3c.dom.Node contextNode)

        Creates the DOM context helper that will be returned by the preResolve method, cached and passed to the marshal methods when they are called. Typically, this stores the DOM document node that was created by parsing the XML source data. The default implementation returns a new instance of SimpleXPathMarshal.DOMContextHelper.

        This method may be overridden to return a sub-class of the SimpleXPathMarshal.DOMContextHelper class if information other than the document node should be stored in the context.

        Parameters:
        contextNode - The context node. Usually (and by default) the DOM document node created by parsing the XML source data.
        Returns:
        A new DOM context helper object.
